wisedevil.test

Class Assert

  • java.lang.Object
    • wisedevil.test.Assert

  • public final class Assert
extends Object
    This class contains the methods to be used to test the code.

    Note that there is no assert() method, since you can use the Java assert keyword. If the assertion fails, the test suit will recognize it and fail the test.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      static void assertException(Runnable code, Class<? extends Exception> exc)
      Fail the test if the supplied exception is not thrown.
      static void assertInstance(Object inst, Class<?> cls)
      Fail the test if inst is not an instance of cls
      static void assertNoException(Runnable code)
      Fail the test if any unchecked exception is thrown.
      static void assertNotNull(Object... args)
      Fail the test if at least one of the args is null.
      static void assertNull(Object... args)
      Fail the test if at least one of the args is not null.
      static void fail()
      Immediately end the test.
      static void fail(String msg)
      Immediately end the test.
